TopicTitle: What is the absolutely first game you remember playing?

Articles.Content: My first game? Easy.... Pong!

I remember getting an original Xbox when I was around Fivish to Sixish, I had two games I played constantly and the first two I remember playing, Test Drive Offroad (I think) And Spongebob Battle for Bikini Bottom, I still play Spongebob for Nostalgia.
It was either Super Mario Bros on the NES, or Wolfenstein 3D. That time frame (3 years old) kinda blends together.

Sim City. Then, Command and Conquer.

They both have since defined by taste in games. (IE, great degree of freedom, with a touch of realism)

Hmmm... not quite sure.

I got it! Win 95 (or was it 98?)
Mechwarrior 2 on Windows 98.
Either Pokemon Silver on GBC or Bubsy 1 on SNES. I still have working copies somewhere (Partially pokemon silver, the battery ran dry a while ago).

Jet Set Willy on the ZX Spectrum.

Back in the day when you loaded everything from tape, and waited at least five minutes for a game to load. Consider that the next time you're waiting for KSP to load.

Same here. This, Manic Miner, and Trap Door are the earliest games I can recall playing.
Pacman on the Atari 2600, I guess

The first game for me was either some battle ship sort of game on my dad's palm pilot or backyard football.

Really it depends on whether or not my dad had his palm pilot before 1999.

And, can I point out how much I love the fact that some of you who love this game are older than him (I'm looking at you, pong dudes).

Super Mario 64

It's basically what got me into games and was the only game I had at the time
Possibly SkiFree on a Windows 95 machine. The snow monster scared the crap out of me.

...my dad had his palm pilot before 1999.

And, can I point out how much I love the fact that some of you who love this game are older than him (I'm looking at you, pong dudes).

We love it because we remember watching or listening to the Apollo program as it was happening

http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/71YPRVDGT2L.gif

My god, I remember that game. I should have it somewhere around still.

Since I was born in 98, I didn't get to enjoy much of the golden game era

First game I recall playing was Lego Island, my aunt still has the same copy, might try and get it to run again.

http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/71YPRVDGT2L.gif

Dang, man, I forgot about that game.

I guess either that or putt putt would win the title for me, then. Nice catch
probibly packman on an atari (i have no idea which one, i was 3).

Dang, man, I forgot about that game.

I guess either that or putt putt would win the title for me, then. Nice catch

Putt-Putt Saves the Zoo!
Trying to think i think it was dig dug or pac man

hmm... the first game I remember playing.... forget which one, but was decidedly something on the atari. frogger or tank or some other game, but on this system lol

THIS model atart lol

after that, my first game on the NES was obviously Super Mario Brothers XD
It was either to the earth or quake.

Tag with my friends.

Oh, you mean on a computer?

Well, the earliest I remember is like roller coaster tycoon or some Mario game I never managed to complete.

Somewhere between Putt Putt, Rollercoaster Tycoon, and Gran Turismo 3.

Putt-Putt Saves the Zoo!

Hello Mr/Mrs topiary creature!

Tic-Tac-Toe on a Digital PDP-8 mini computer way back in 72. It was a very powerful computer with a whopping 6k bytes of memory which was a step up from the 4k it came with as stock, a teletype for output, and used punched paper tape to store program code.
